articles.author: Humeyra Pamuk
articles.description: As the Gaza war nears its first anniversary, previously unreported email exchanges between senior Biden administration officials show that Washington was warned early on that Israel might be committing war crimes.
articles.title: Emails show early US concerns over Gaza offensive, risk of Israeli war crimes

articles.author: Timour Azhari, Ari Rabinovitch
articles.description: Israel bombed central Beirut in the early hours of Thursday, killing at least six people, after its forces suffered their deadliest day on the Lebanese front in a year of clashes against Iran-backed armed group Hezbollah.
articles.title: Israel strikes heart of Beirut, killing six

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Ukrainian air force said on Friday that Russia attacked critical infrastructure in the country with 19 drones overnight.
articles.title: Ukraine says Russia attacked its critical infrastructure with 19 drones

articles.author: Khalid Abdelaziz, Aidan Lewis
articles.description: After almost 18 months of war, fighting in Sudan is escalating as seasonal rains end with the army using intensified airstrikes and allied fighters to shore up its position ahead of a likely surge by the rival Rapid Support Forces (RSF).
articles.title: Sudan's war to intensify as rainy season draws to a close

articles.author: Aram Roston, Alexandra Ulmer
articles.description: Jared Kushner, son-in-law of former U.S. President Donald Trump, has discussed U.S.-Saudi diplomatic negotiations involving Israel with Saudi Arabia’s Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman multiple times since leaving the Trump White House, said a source familiar with the discussions.
articles.title: Exclusive:  Kushner has discussed U.S.-Saudi diplomacy with Saudi crown prince

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: An Australian court upheld an order on Friday for Elon Musk's X to pay a fine of A$610,500 ($418,000) for failing to cooperate with a regulator's request for information about anti-child-abuse practices.
articles.title: Australian court upholds order for Musk's X to pay $418,000 fine over anti-child abuse probe

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Malaysia's Prime Minister Anwar Ibrahim is set to arrive in Bangladesh on Friday for talks primarily focused on labour issues, according to Dhaka officials.
articles.title: Malaysia PM Anwar Ibrahim to visit Bangladesh, focus on labour issues

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Kremlin on Friday accused Ukrainian authorities of playing with fire, a day after Russian forces said they had intercepted a Ukrainian drone near the Kursk nuclear plant and some news outlets reported a fire had broken out several miles away.
articles.title: Kremlin accuses Ukraine of 'playing with fire' after reported attack near Kursk nuclear plant

articles.author: Asif Shahzad
articles.description: Authorities in Pakistan sealed off the capital, Islamabad, and blocked cellphone services on Friday to prevent an anti-government rally by supporters of jailed former Prime Minister Imran Khan, officials said.
articles.title: Pakistan seals off capital, blocks cellphones  ahead of protest by Imran Khan's party

articles.author: Nyasha Chingono
articles.description: The Zimbabwean government will this month pay an initial $20 million to foreign white and local Black farmers who lost land in farm invasions under former leader Robert Mugabe at the turn of the century, the finance minister said on Friday.
articles.title: Zimbabwe compensates foreign and local farmers over land invasions
